#MB++ Technical Manual
--ARRAYGET--
Gets data from an array.
Set A, B, C or D to a number and it will be replace with the
character at that position in the array.
-Input:
A, B, C or D position in the array
$v array to use ($v = "a")
-Output:
A, B, C or D output from array.
-Notes:
There are 4 arrays and they are each limited to 100 positions.
Uses memory between 60000-60399.
Arrays do NOT edit your text variables. They are saved in memory.
-Used in:
(none)
-Uses:
ERRBOX
